snippet.title: Speed Freak - (1979) - Arcade - gameplay
snippet.description:
Vectorbeam © 1979
[Coin-Op] Arcade Video Game
Emulator: MAME 0.232

This is a cool Vector-graphic driving game from a new company called "Vectorbeam" wouldn't you know it.  It's a step up from Night Driver, in that the vector graphics are sharp and smooth, and now we have various objects we get to pass on the side of the road:  a cow, a cactus, a basketball hoop, a hitchhiker.  Police setup half-road roadblocks (not doing a good job there police), and you have to drive around those.  Then there is oncoming traffic in the left lane, so you need to avoid that.  And... going off the road causes your windshield to crack violently everytime - so you want to avoid that too.  

Bottom line... just stay on the road and drive fast.  I actually vaguely remember trying to play this as a young 5 or 6 year-old boy now.  Kinda scary it was, and exhilarating.  The one challenge on MAME is its impossible to control - at least I couldn't figure out any decent settings.  So you get very familiar with crashing.  Very tricky.
